alert.note: Alert for Westchester (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 29 at 5:26PM EDT until September 29 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and elevated streams continues * WHERE...Portions of southern Connecticut, including the following county, Fairfield. Portions of southeast New York, including the following county, Westchester. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 526 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges heavy rain which resulted in elevated stream flows. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Little additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Stamford, Norwalk, White Plains, Port Chester, New Canaan, Tarrytown, Mount Kisco, Dobbs Ferry, Fairfield, Greenwich, Harrison, Westport, Ridgefield, Darien, Wilton, Scarsdale, Weston, Hawthorne, Bedford and Rye Brook. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
